title: Sagalla (1897) John
description:
KiSagalla, the less spoken of the two dialects of the Taita language (see also KiDabida), is used in the Teita Hills of southeastern Kenya. It is giving way to the Dabida usage, which, quite distinct linguistically, is related to Swahili.

1892 Mark; 1897 John; 1912 Gospels BFBS, London Translated byJ. Alfred Wray, Church MS.
provider: The British and Foreign Bible Society

language.name: Sagalla
language.area: Coast Province, Taita District, Taita Hills, Sagala Hill slopes.
